Title: Project Setup
Description: Create Vercel project & GitHub repo; scaffold SPA + serverless; add /api/ping

Title: Create Vercel proj & repo
Description: Initialize repo, connect to Vercel, configure build

Title: Scaffold SPA + functions
Description: Base folders for client and /api routes

Title: Proxy Layer
Description: Solscan & Meteora proxy endpoints with retries, throttling, headers

Title: UI Parity
Description: Desktop-first layout, two tabs, parameter panels, tables

Title: UX polish
Description: Sorting, copy links, empty & error states

Title: Validation & Handover
Description: Run validation on two pools; docs

Title: Parity UI â€” Tabs & Inputs
Given: Given the user opens the app on desktop
Then: Then the UI shows PositionPnL & WalletPoolPnL tabs with parameter panels mirroring the extension

Title: Find Transactions
Given: Given a pool and date range are set
When: When the user clicks Find Transactions
Then: Then the app paginates Solscan add/remove-liquidity events and displays a table with tx_id, tx_time_iso, tx_type, wallet_address (if resolvable), and links

Title: Find Positions
When: When the user clicks Find Positions
Then: Then the app resolves positions (position_address, wallet_address) and marks rows accordingly

Title: Fetch Position Data & PnL
Given: Given at least one position is identified
When: When the user clicks Fetch Position Data
Then: Then the app retrieves position details and computes realized pnl_usd and duration_hours

Title: CSV Export
Given: Given the current table has data
When: When the user clicks Export CSV
Then: Then a CSV downloads with the approved schema and formatting

Title: Error Handling
When: When the proxy/API returns an error
Then: Then the app shows a clear message and a Retry action; transient errors auto-retry once

Title: Performance Guardrails
When: When the user runs the flow end-to-end
Then: Then the app remains responsive and tables stay interactive

Headers/Notes: x-api-key (if required), origin spoof via proxy, backoff

Purpose: API key for Meteora endpoints if required
Name: METEORA_API_KEY
Notes: Set on Vercel; never exposed client-side

Purpose: Referer header value expected by upstream
Name: UPSTREAM_REFERER
Notes: Set on Vercel; injected in proxy requests

Purpose: If Solscan enforces API keys on selected endpoints
Name: SOLSCAN_API_KEY

Mitigation: Proxy injects headers; server-side key storage; fallback messaging
Retry with jitter; token bucket; user Retry
Row links for manual verification; clear provenance
Keys never in client; Vercel env vars only
